message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.AI 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the problem of inconsistencies within and between security policies and other specifications, which falls under the domain of computer security (cs.CR) and software engineering (cs.SE). The tool developed in the paper is based on the CHR language, which is a declarative programming language used for constraint handling (cs.PL). The paper also mentions workflow specifications, which are commonly used in business process management and software engineering (cs.LO). Finally, the use of CHR language and the detection of inconsistencies can be seen as an application of artificial intelligence techniques (cs.AI).
